page.title: 07SIR JOHN MOORE SCHOOL PART 2
page.content: The school was originally{free}for the boys of the local area but soon concentrated upon{fee paying boarders. In the 1860's there was complete separation into Grammar and English (free) Schools.{In 1904}the{Grammar {school closed}due to lack of support and the whole building became the village{boys elementary school. This{closed in 1933}and the boys transferred to the girls church school in the village.During the{2nd. World {War}the building was used by the {military}and then stood{disused}until the school{reopened}as the village primary school{in 1957. The{dormitories}are now used only as store rooms.The{dome}is in a bad state of repair but the{clock}was restored in 1984.However the village children enjoy working in the beautiful building, just as Sir John wanted!
